issues.description: The problem statement and template repository refer to an interface named `Rideable`, but the solution repository defines and uses an interface named `Mountable` for the same purpose. This mismatch will confuse students and break compilation when they compare their own `Rideable` implementation against the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the interface in the solution repository from `Mountable` to `Rideable` and update all implementing classes and references to match the problem statement and template.

issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to an interface named 'Rideable', but the solution repository defines and uses an interface named 'Mountable' for the same concept, causing a mismatch that can confuse students when mapping requirements to implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the interface 'Mountable' in the solution repository to 'Rideable' and update all references (such as in Seal.java and Pig.java) to implement 'Rideable' so that the interface name is consistent across problem, template, and solution.
